titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Mrs. J. E. Thane (Laura Thane Whipple) papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Sara Ramsey.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-10-25T11:59-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Mrs. J. E. Thane (Laura Thane Whipple) papers
did.abstract: Correspondence, printed matter, and miscellanea, relating to food conservation in Alameda County and to European relief work of various organizations during World War I.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Mrs. J. E. Thane papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1958.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the library catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Laura Thane Whipple was born in 1875 and died in 1966. She was the United States Food Administration Woman Director of Food Conservation for Alameda County, California, during World War I.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers contain correspondence, printed matter, and miscellanea, relating to food conservation in Alameda County and to European relief work of various organizations during World War I. The papers include official guidelines for conservation of food and household items, with an emphasis on relief in Belgium and France. Two main organizations reflected in the papers include the United States Food Administration and Department of Agriculture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains letters from the Friends of Belgium organization, Alameda County Republican Assembly, and the Republican State Committee.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous correspondence and U.S. Food Administration reports and guidelines,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains reports and direct correspondence from the United States Food Administration in Washington, D.C. Includes home conservation guidelines for women in charge of purchasing and preparing food for their family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One print of an unidentified woman and one print of an unidentified man and woman in a Red Cross car.

did.unittitle: Postcards of Henriette, Queen of Belgium,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to Red Cross of Romania.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Emphasis on shipment records and logistics for Belgium and France.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Red Cross signs, memoranda from the U.S. Treasury Department regarding conservation and the war effort, and U.S. Department of Agriculture Weekly Newsletter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes The Call, San Francisco; The Township Register, Alameda County; Oakland Edition of the San Francisco Examiner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes The Spirt of the Nation, a pamphlet containing influential American songs and documents. Other items include war time aid booklets, encouraging Americans to do their part.

did.unittitle: U.S. Department of Agriculture, U.S. Food Administration, and U.S. Treasury printed materials,
U.S. Department of Agriculture and U.S. Food Administration official printed reports and news releases,
U.S. Food Administration, Official Food Bulletin,
U.S. Food Administration reports, Alameda County,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes U.S. Food Administration promotional signs and sugar purchase receipts.
